meanings.definition: Severe self-discipline and avoidance of all forms of indulgence, typically for religious reasons.
meanings.sent1: The monk's asceticism included fasting and praying for long hours.
meanings.sent2: Her asceticism led her to give up material possessions and live a minimalist lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: Despite his asceticism, he couldn't resist sneaking a piece of chocolate once in a while.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to asceticism was as unwavering as a mountain standing tall.
meanings.sent5: The asceticism of the ancient hermit was legendary, inspiring many to seek a simpler life.

meanings.definition: The practice of living a simple and austere life, often for spiritual reasons.
meanings.sent1: In the monastery, asceticism was valued more than material wealth.
meanings.sent2: Many people are drawn to asceticism as a way to find inner peace and clarity.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him for his asceticism, calling him the 'minimalist master'.
meanings.sent4: The asceticism of the desert fathers was a beacon of light in a world of excess.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of asceticism lies in its ability to strip away distractions and focus on what truly matters.
